Title: AI-Powered Personalized Recipe Recommendation and Smart Kitchen Assistant
Problem Statement: Many users struggle with meal planning and grocery shopping, leading to food waste and unhealthy eating habits. Existing recipe platforms lack personalization and real-time adaptation based on available ingredients and dietary restrictions. This project aims to develop an AI-powered system that recommends personalized recipes based on user preferences, available ingredients (detected via image recognition of fridge contents), and dietary needs. It will integrate with a smart kitchen assistant to guide users through cooking processes, adjust recipes on-the-fly, and minimize food waste.
Prerequisites: Computer Vision (image recognition), Natural Language Processing (recipe parsing), Recommender Systems, Android development
Access to recipe datasets (e.g., Recipe1M, Yummly)
Infrastructure Requirements: Cloud compute for model training (Google Colab or similar)
Value Proposition: Commercial PoC potential for Samsung SmartThings ecosystem integration
Potential for publication in the area of personalized nutrition and AI-driven cooking

Milestones.M2: Prototype ingredient detection model based on image recognition.
Milestones.M4: Functional recipe recommendation engine integrating user preferences and ingredient availability.
Milestones.M6: Mobile app prototype with voice-guided cooking assistance.

Title: Real-Time Audio-Visual Emotion Recognition for Enhanced Video Conferencing
Problem Statement: Current video conferencing tools lack the ability to understand participants' emotional states, hindering effective communication and empathy. This project aims to develop an on-device AI system that accurately recognizes emotions from both facial expressions and speech patterns in real-time during video calls. The system will provide subtle cues to participants or moderators to improve engagement and address potential conflicts.
KPIs: User satisfaction with the system's feedback
Prerequisites: Computer Vision (facial expression recognition), Natural Language Processing (speech emotion recognition), Deep Learning, Android/iOS development
Value Proposition: Commercial PoC potential for Samsung video conferencing solutions
Viable patent filing for on-device emotion recognition algorithms

Title: AI-Powered Predictive Maintenance for IoT-Enabled Home Appliances
Problem Statement: Unplanned appliance failures cause inconvenience and financial loss for consumers. This project aims to develop an on-device AI system that predicts potential failures in IoT-enabled home appliances (e.g., washing machines, refrigerators) by analyzing sensor data (temperature, vibration, power consumption). The system will alert users to schedule maintenance before failures occur, extending appliance lifespan and reducing repair costs.
Prerequisites: Time Series Analysis, Machine Learning (classification, regression), IoT device integration, Data mining
Infrastructure Requirements: IoT-enabled home appliance (or simulated sensor data)
Value Proposition: Commercial PoC potential for Samsung SmartThings ecosystem (preventive maintenance services)
Potential for publication in the area of predictive maintenance and IoT

Milestones.M2: Collection and analysis of sensor data from home appliances.
Milestones.M4: Trained machine learning model for predicting appliance failures.
Milestones.M6: Integration of the model into a mobile app for monitoring appliance health.

Title: Generative AI-Based Personalized Content Creation for Mobile Devices
Problem Statement: Users often struggle to create engaging and visually appealing content for social media and personal use. This project aims to develop an on-device generative AI model capable of creating personalized content (images, short videos, text) based on user prompts and preferences. The model will leverage techniques like text-to-image generation and style transfer to produce high-quality content optimized for mobile devices.
Prerequisites: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), Deep Learning, Mobile app development
Value Proposition: Commercial PoC potential for Samsung mobile device features (creative tools)
Potential for publication in the area of generative AI and mobile content creation

Milestones.M2: Training of a generative model for image/video creation.
Milestones.M4: Development of a user interface for inputting prompts and customizing content.
Milestones.M6: Integration of the model into a mobile app for generating personalized content.

Title: AI-Powered Smart Gardening Assistant using Computer Vision and Sensor Data
Problem Statement: Many users lack the knowledge and time to effectively care for their plants. This project aims to develop an AI-powered smart gardening assistant that uses computer vision to identify plant species, assess their health (detect diseases, nutrient deficiencies), and provide personalized care recommendations. The system will also integrate with sensor data (soil moisture, temperature, light levels) to optimize watering and fertilization schedules.
KPIs: Plant health improvement (measured through growth rate/yield)
Prerequisites: Computer Vision (image classification, object detection), Machine Learning (classification, regression), Sensor data analysis, Mobile app development
Infrastructure Requirements: Soil moisture sensors, temperature sensors, light sensors (optional)
Value Proposition: Commercial PoC potential for Samsung SmartThings ecosystem (smart home gardening solutions)
Potential for publication in the area of precision agriculture and AI-driven gardening

Milestones.M2: Trained plant identification model with high accuracy.
Milestones.M4: Development of a disease/deficiency detection model.
Milestones.M6: Integration of the model and sensor data into a mobile app for providing personalized care recommendations.
